page.title: 06Farming
page.content: {The Leys}is a farm just outside Weobley, run by the Carr family and covering about 400 acres.The house is {black and white}having been built in 1589 by a builder called{James {Bridges. The{timber framed}farmhouse is situated three quarters of a mile south west of Sarnesfield and is worthy of special mention.When it was originally built it was only small but later extensions have produced an {imposing residence}with 6 rooms downstairs,6 bedrooms plus numerous small rooms. The farm is used for animals and crops.{Sugar beet}is produced commercially and sold to Silver Spoon. Barley and hay are grown to feed the 3 horses and supplement the silage fed to the cows.
